basic.floral_language:
xGraptoveria 'Douglas Huth'
Floriography: glorious, tender, lovely
Is a hybrid succulent, leaves loosely arranged in a rosette, long oval shape with tips, covered by a layer of white powders, with great diurnal temperature range and abundant sunlight, leaves turn pink, look glorious, suitable for decoration on desks or in bedrooms. 
Likes sunny places, tolerates to half shade, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, pale yellow.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, light yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color blue green, when sunny turning to pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, resistant to half shade, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
